newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: NZ dwelling permits fall 1.6 pct in Apr yr/yr.
newsitem.headline: NZ dwelling permits fall 1.6 pct in Apr yr/yr.

text.p: Statistics New Zealand said on Wednesday that an estimated 1,970 new dwelling units were authorised for construction in April, down 1.6 percent on April 1996.
According to the statistics bureau, the data shows that the short-term trend estimate continues to track steadily.
"This period of relative stability follows three years of large variation in dewlling consent statistics," it said.

The trend estimate increased by 0.5 percent from March to April 1997, in line with the growth recorded earlier in the year. Since October 1996, the trend has been showing increases of between zero and 1.6 percent, following five successive decreases in the trend estimate, the SNZ added.
